title: [Proposal] Evaluate Memvid for AI context management
description:
## Summary

Evaluate [Memvid](https://memvid.com/) as a context management layer for:
1. **Claude Code development context** (`.claude/` knowledge base)
2. **User agent context in TinyCloud** (user preferences, history)

## What is Memvid?

Memvid is a portable AI memory system that replaces vector databases with a single file. Two implementations exist:

| Version | Format | Embeddings | Features |
|---------|--------|------------|----------|
| [Python (original)](https://github.com/Olow304/memvid) | `.mp4` (QR codes in video) | SentenceTransformers + FAISS | 50-100x smaller than vector DBs |
| [Rust (new)](https://github.com/memvid/memvid) | `.mv2` (single file) | ONNX + HNSW | Sub-5ms retrieval, MCP server |

### Key Benefits
- **Single-file portable**: No database infrastructure needed
- **Offline-capable**: Works entirely locally after initial indexing
- **MCP integration**: [memvid_mcp_server](https://github.com/angrysky56/memvid_mcp_server) exposes tools to Claude
- **Sub-5ms search**: Fast semantic retrieval

## Can It Work With 500MB Local Qwen?

**⚠️ Critical misunderstanding to clarify:**

Memvid needs an **embedding model**, NOT a chat LLM. These are different:

| Model Type | Purpose | Example | Size |
|------------|---------|---------|------|
| **Chat LLM** | Generate text responses | Qwen-0.5B, Qwen-1.8B | 500MB-2GB |
| **Embedding Model** | Convert text → vectors | Qwen3-Embedding-0.6B | ~600MB |

### Embedding Options for Local Use

| Model | Size | Format | Notes |
|-------|------|--------|-------|
| [Qwen3-Embedding-0.6B-ONNX](https://huggingface.co/onnx-community/Qwen3-Embedding-0.6B-ONNX) | ~600MB (q8: ~300MB) | ONNX | Multilingual, 100+ languages |
| [all-MiniLM-L6-v2](https://huggingface.co/sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2) | ~90MB | PyTorch/ONNX | Smaller, English-focused |
| [Model2Vec distilled](https://huggingface.co/futur/Qwen3-Embedding-0.6B-model2vec-onnx) | <50MB | ONNX | 500x faster, lower quality |

**Answer:** Yes, but you need an embedding model alongside (or instead of) your chat LLM.

## Use Case Analysis

### 1. `.claude/` Development Context ✅ VIABLE

**What it could do:**
- Index all specs, learnings, reflections into one `.mv2` file
- Enable semantic search over project knowledge
- Persist context between sessions
- MCP server exposes tools for RAG-style queries

**Integration path:**
```
specs/ + .claude/LEARNINGS.md + reflections/
    ↓ (index once)
.claude/context.mv2 (single file)
    ↓ (MCP server)
Claude Code queries via tool calls
```

**Pros:**
- Better context retrieval than file search
- Survives compaction/session clears
- Single portable file

**Cons:**
- Adds complexity (embedding model + memvid runtime)
- Re-indexing needed when docs change
- MCP server is separate process to manage

### 2. TinyCloud User Agent Context ❌ MISALIGNED

**Why this doesn't fit:**

TinyCloud and Memvid solve different problems:

| Aspect | TinyCloud | Memvid |
|--------|-----------|--------|
| **Purpose** | Decentralized user data storage | AI memory/RAG |
| **Data** | Avatars, profiles, settings | Text chunks + embeddings |
| **Search** | Key-value lookup | Semantic similarity |
| **User-facing** | Yes | No (AI tool) |

**Current TinyCloud usage in Villa:**
- Custom avatar uploads (images)
- Cross-device profile sync

**What "user agent context" would need:**
- User preferences, chat history, behavioral patterns
- This is application state, not semantic memory
- Better served by database + simple key-value storage

**Recommendation:** Don't force Memvid into TinyCloud. They're orthogonal.

## Cost/Benefit Analysis

### For `.claude/` Context

| Factor | Assessment |
|--------|------------|
| **Setup effort** | Medium (install embedding model, run MCP server) |
| **Maintenance** | Low (re-index on doc changes) |
| **Value** | Medium (better than grep, worse than Claude's native understanding) |
| **Risk** | Low (purely optional tooling) |

### For TinyCloud User Context

| Factor | Assessment |
|--------|------------|
| **Setup effort** | High (would need custom integration layer) |
| **Maintenance** | High (sync issues, embedding drift) |
| **Value** | Low (overkill for user preferences) |
| **Risk** | Medium (adds complexity to user-facing path) |

## Recommendation

### Do: Experiment with `.claude/` context

1. Install memvid MCP server locally
2. Index `specs/` and `.claude/LEARNINGS.md`
3. Test retrieval quality over 1-2 weeks
4. If valuable, document as optional developer tool

### Don't: Integrate with TinyCloud

- TinyCloud is for user data (avatars, profiles)
- User "context" is better served by:
  - Session storage (ephemeral preferences)
  - Database (persistent preferences)
  - Browser localStorage (device-specific)

## Decision Points

**Before proceeding:**
1. Is semantic search over project docs actually a pain point?
2. Do we have the ~600MB budget for an embedding model?
3. Who maintains the MCP server process?
4. Is the value worth the complexity?

## Resources

- [Memvid Documentation](https://docs.memvid.com)
- [GitHub: memvid/memvid (Rust)](https://github.com/memvid/memvid)
- [GitHub: Olow304/memvid (Python)](https://github.com/Olow304/memvid)
- [Memvid MCP Server](https://github.com/angrysky56/memvid_mcp_server)
- [Qwen3-Embedding-0.6B-ONNX](https://huggingface.co/onnx-community/Qwen3-Embedding-0.6B-ONNX)
